The website Axios noted last month that Churkin is one of six Russian diplomats to have died under mysterious circumstances since November.
On Nov. 8, Election Day, a Russian diplomat named Sergei Krivov died after being found unconscious in the Russian Consulate in New York.
Also on Dec. 19, Peter Polshikov, a Russian diplomat who worked in Latin America, was fatally shot in his Moscow apartment.
His death has fueled conspiracy theories given a spate of other Russian diplomats’ demise in recent months.
On Dec. 19, Russia’s ambassador to Turkey, Andrei Karlov, was assassinated by a lone gunman in Ankara.
And the New York City medical examiner’s decision will no doubt raise additional questions.
On Jan. 9, Andrei Malanin, the Russian consul in Athens, was found dead in his apartment.
Alexander Kadakin, Russia’s ambassador to India, died after a short illness on Jan. 27.
Oleg Erovinkin was found dead in the back of his car on Dec. 26.
